creator: Stephane.Gobance@continental-corporation.com
text:
The description of the AntCall task is erroneous:
The three paragraphs after the first sentence comes from a copy/paste of the Ant
task description. They deal with the concept of new project but AntCall task
does not transfer control to another project (another build.xml file) but to
another target in the same project (the same build.xml file). I have understood
what the author want to describe about properties inheritance and/or visibility
but I think that it is not correctly stated.

creator: carej@us.ibm.com
text:
Build files are not equivalent to projects: you can have multiple projects that
all are parsed from the same build.xml file. You can think of a project as a
parsed instance of a given build file.

<antcall> does in fact transfer control to another project, because the current
file is reparsed into a new project and then the desired target of that project
is executed. <antcall> works in this fashion to prevent the called target from
polluting the environment of the caller.
